text: Siri Bjerke (19 June 1958 – 11 February 2012) was a Norwegian politician (Labour Party). She was substitute member of the Norwegian legislature between 1997 and 2005, state secretary in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs between 1993 and 1997 and Minister of the Environment between 2000 and 2001 during Stoltenberg's first cabinet. After leaving politics she worked as a director for the Confederation of Norwegian Enterprise (2002–2005) and for Innovation Norway (2005–). She studied psychology at the University of Oslo. ==References== * *Obituary in Dagbladet Category:1958 births Category:2012 deaths Category:Ministers of Climate and the Environment of Norway Category:Deputy members of the Storting Category:Labour Party (Norway) politicians Category:Innovation Norway people Category:Deaths from cancer in Norway Category:Women government ministers of Norway Category:20th-century Norwegian women politicians Category:20th-century Norwegian politicians Category:Women members of the Storting
title: Siri Bjerke
